page.title: 02Durie House.
page.content: The present Durie House was built in 1762,although Durie Estate goes back to about the 14th Century. The Christie family came over with William the Conqueror. The name Durie means place of many springs several of which are still there. The present Letham Glen was bought by Mr John Letham in 1925 from Christie of Durie and was given to the town of Leven. The great great grandfather of Mr Christie (the present owner) was a midshipman on H.M.S. Bellerophon the ship to which Napoleon surrendered to of the coast of Normandy in August 1815.(H.M.S.Bellerophon was one of the ships which fought at the Battle of Trafalgar,under the command of Vice-Admiral Collingwood.)
